DOC.brief_summary: The goal of this project is to develop a patient-centered decision aid for decision-making about end-stage heart failure treatment. This study seeks to create a decision aid that presents outcomes, risks, projected experiences, and uncertainties about Left Ventricular Assist Device (LVAD) placement to help patients make values-based decisions about placement. The investigators propose a mixed methods design involving a literature search of clinical evidence, semi-structured patient interviews, and quantitative data from a multi-site trial of patients receiving the decision aid compared to patients not receiving the aid.
DOC.brief_title: Development & Testing of a Decision Aid for LVAD Placement
DOC.criteria: LVAD Candidates (NYHA Class III and IV patients with an acceptable surgical risk/benefit ratio for LVAD implantation and with good psychosocial support, coping mechanisms, and financial resources, as determined by "clearance" from the transplant social worker) LVAD Patients LVAD Decliners LVAD Caregivers subjects who lack the capacity to give informed consent
